page.title: 02Farming in Yewdale
page.content: {FARMING}Sheep farming is the main type of agriculture in our area with the {Herdwick}&{Swaledale}breeds being most important. The sheep graze on the open fell for most of the year but are gathered for dipping,clipping,putting to the rams, castrating & dosing. They are{"heafed"}to their own fell i.e. they know it and always return to it. Store cattle are grazed on the lower slopes and the calves are suckled by the cows using the multi-suckler approach. {Forestry}is an important branch of farming in Cumbria and coniferous plantations are to be found but the old established deciduous coppice woodland is still an important part of the local scene where it occurs on lower slopes and in valleys. Fewer people now work on fell farms because of increased mechanisation.
